sentences.en: But I'm also pleased to get nominate for Jesseas well.
sentences.cn: 但是我也很高兴因《刺杀神枪侠》而获提名.

sentences.en: Companies at present nominate their own directors.
sentences.cn: 目前,各公司的董事由公司自己提名.

sentences.en: Each member may nominate only one candidate.
sentences.cn: 每名委员只可提出一名候选人.

sentences.en: Everyone knows that whomever you nominate will have my support.
sentences.cn: 每个人都知道你提名的任何人都会得到我的支援.

sentences.en: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.cn: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.en: I nominate jack for the job.
I nominate Tom to make the tea.
If I were sole owner I would nominate you this moment.
sentences.cn: 假如我是独资老板,我现在就可任命你.

sentences.en: It is legally possible for an elderly person to nominate someone to act for them, should they become incapable of looking after themselves.
sentences.cn: 从法律上来说，如果老人生活不能自理，他可以指定某人为其代理事务。

sentences.en: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.cn: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

sentences.en: No candidate may nominate himself or herself. Past recipients cannot be re - nominated.
sentences.cn: 候选人不能提名其本人. 过去的获奖者不能够再被提名.

sentences.en: Only students may nominate someone for the award.
sentences.cn: 只有学生才可以提名一些教师去拿这个奖项.

sentences.en: The EU would nominate two members to the committee.
sentences.cn: 欧盟将为该委员会指定两名成员。

sentences.en: The guide urges them to nominate a specific individual or departments compliance.
sentences.cn: 而且细则还要求各类机构,安排专人或具体的部门来承担这项工作.

sentences.en: The public will be able to nominate candidates for awards such as the MBE.
sentences.cn: 公众将可以推荐诸如英帝国勋章之类的奖项的候选人。

sentences.en: They nominate Mr. Li head of the section.
sentences.cn: 他们任命李先生为科长.

sentences.en: This week one of them will be nominated by the Democratic Party for the presidency of the United States.
sentences.cn: 本周他们中的一人将被民主党提名为美国总统职位的候选人。

sentences.en: Three subspecies are currently recognized, including the nominate subspecies described here.
sentences.cn: 目前德州细盲蛇下有三个亚种已被确认.

words.tran_cn: 主格的；记名的；被提名的
被任命者；被提名的人；代名人

trans.tran_en: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

trans.tran_cn: 提名…为候选人，任命，挑选，指定（时间、日期、名称等）
trans.tran_en: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize
